item.title: Progressive 季度利润因强劲的汽车保险需求而大幅增长
item.description: 保险商 Progressive 周三公布的第一季度利润增长了 10%，这主要得益于汽车保单需求的恢复性增长。【原文：Insurer Progressive reported a 10% jump in first-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by resilient demand for its auto insurance policies.】

item.title: 世界贸易组织下调 2025 年贸易增长预测，警告将出现更严重的衰退
item.description: 世界贸易组织周三大幅下调了对全球商品贸易的预测，从稳健增长转为下降，称美国进一步征收关税和外溢效应可能导致全球商品贸易出现自 COVID 大流行以来最严重的下滑。【原文：The World Trade Organization sharply cut its forecast for global merchandise trade from solid growth to a decline on Wednesday, saying further U.S. tariffs and spillover effects could lead to the heaviest slump since the height of the COVID pandemic.】

item.title: Lyft 投资方 Engine Capital 将在代理权争夺战中提名董事会成员
item.description: 激进投资者 Engine Capital 正在为 Lyft 的代理权争夺战做准备，准备提名两名董事进入这家叫车公司的董事会。【原文：Activist investor Engine Capital is gearing up for a proxy battle at Lyft , as it prepares to nominate two directors to the board of the ride-hailing company.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份零售额激增，原因是关税前汽车购买量增加
item.description: 尽管对经济前景的担忧损害了可自由支配的支出，但由于家庭在关税出台前增加了机动车的购买，美国 3 月份的零售销售额激增。【原文：U.S. retail sales surged in March as households boosted purchases of motor vehicles ahead of tariffs, though concerns about the economic outlook are hurting discretionary spending.】

item.title: 消息人士称，印度希望在贸易谈判中终止对美国乙烷和液化石油气征收进口税
item.description: 三位熟悉内情的消息人士称，印度计划在与华盛顿进行的更广泛谈判中终止对美国进口乙烷和液化石油气（LPG）征税，因为印度希望减少贸易顺差并减轻关税负担。【原文：India plans to end taxes on U.S. ethane and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) imports under broader negotiations with Washington as it looks to reduce its trade surplus and ease its tariff burden, three sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Lyft 斥资 2 亿美元收购 FreeNow，进军欧洲市场
item.description: Lyft 美国公司周三表示，将以 1.75 亿欧元（约合 1.984 亿美元）的价格从德国汽车巨头宝马和梅赛德斯-奔驰手中收购移动平台 FreeNow，以进军欧洲叫车市场。【原文：Lyft is buying mobility platform FreeNow from German automotive giants BMW and Mercedes-Benz for 175 million euros ($198.40 million) to expand into the European ride-hailing market, the U.S. company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 糖尿病设备需求强劲，雅培季度利润超预期
item.description: 受糖尿病护理和其他医疗设备需求强劲的推动，雅培实验室周三公布的第一季度利润超出华尔街预期。【原文：Abbott Laboratories beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Wednesday, buoyed by strong demand for diabetes care and other medical devices.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率上周跃升至两个月新高
item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）继续深化贸易战，金融市场经历了动荡的一周，上周最受欢迎的美国住房贷款利率跃升至 6.81%，创下两个月来的最高水平。【原文：The interest rate for the most popular U.S. home loan jumped to 6.81% last week, its highest level in two months, following a turbulent week for financial markets as President Donald Trump pressed on with a deepening trade war.】

item.title: 英伟达（Nvidia）警告美国出口限制将带来巨大冲击，全球芯片类股下滑
item.description: 周三，全球芯片类股暴跌，原因是华盛顿限制了英伟达（Nvidia）为中国量身定制的一款人工智能芯片的出口，进一步切断了中国这个至关重要的半导体增长市场，此举将使这家人工智能先驱企业损失55亿美元的费用。【原文：Global chip stocks slumped on Wednesday after Washington curbed exports of an AI chip Nvidia had tailored for China, further cutting off the crucial growth market for semiconductors in a move that will cost the AI pioneer $5.5 billion in charges.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火造成 20 亿美元损失，保险公司 Travelers 利润下降
item.description: 旅行者保险公司（Travelers）周三表示，由于洛杉矶野火导致创纪录的超过 20 亿美元的灾难损失，该公司第一季度利润骤降 60%。【原文：Travelers' profit plunged 60% in the first quarter as its exposure to the Los Angeles wildfires led to a record catastrophe loss of over $2 billion, the insurance bellwether said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 文件显示，沃尔玛与钦奈办事处达成交易，提升在印度的科技影响力
item.description: 沃尔玛在印度南部城市钦奈签署了第二个办公空间的协议，钦奈在作为制造业中心闻名多年后，正迅速崛起为一个重要的技术中心。【原文：Walmart has signed a deal for a second office space in the southern Indian city of Chennai, which is fast emerging as a major technology center after being known for years as a manufacturing hub.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司股价上涨，原因是预售恢复强劲
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周三在盘前交易中表示，尽管关税引发了经济不确定性，但该公司本季度迄今为止的远期预订量保持稳定。【原文：United Airlines shares rose on Wednesday in premarket trading, lifting up peers, after it said forward bookings were stable so far in the current quarter despite tariff-induced economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 美国 中美贸易战全面开打
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 中国工厂力争在美国贸易战中保持出口乐趣
item.description: 张斌从事的是娱乐行业，但由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的缘故，他的工作变得不那么有趣了。【原文：Bin Zhang is in the business of fun, but his job has become less so because of U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 联合国贸易机构称，贸易紧张局势可能导致全球经济增长放缓至 2.3
item.description: 联合国贸易和发展会议（UNCTAD）周三表示，由于贸易紧张局势和不确定性推动了衰退趋势，全球经济增长可能放缓至2.3%。【原文：Global economic growth could slow to 2.3% as trade tensions and uncertainty drive a recessionary trend, the UN Trade and Development (UNCTAD) agency said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 印度 Wipro 第四季度营收不及预期
item.description: 印度第四大软件服务供应商 Wipro 公布的第四季度收入低于预期，原因是宏观不确定性影响了客户支出。【原文：Wipro , India's fourth-largest software services provider, posted lower-than-expected revenue for the fourth quarter, hurt by macro uncertainties weighing on client spending.】

item.title: 瑞典汽车齿轮制造商 Autoliv 第一季度利润增幅超预期，股价上涨
item.description: 瑞典汽车设备制造商奥托立夫（Autoliv）周三公布，尽管地缘政治和市场存在不确定性，但其第一季度调整后营业利润仍高于预期，并重申了 2025 年的销售和盈利指导目标。【原文：Swedish car equipment maker Autoliv reported a first-quarter adjusted operating profit above expectations on Wednesday and reiterated its 2025 sales and profitability guidance despite geopolitical and market uncertainties.】

item.title: 关税带来不确定性，美联储主席鲍威尔将发表新经济观点
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）反复无常的关税政策给经济前景注入了巨大的不确定性，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周三将在不到两周的时间内第二次发表讲话，阐述他对美国通胀和就业形势的看法，以及如果美国通胀和就业形势偏离正轨，央行可能会采取的措施。【原文：With U.S. President Donald Trump's erratic tariff policy injecting tremendous uncertainty into the economic outlook, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday will for the second time in less than two weeks weigh in with his sense of what's in store for Americans on inflation and jobs, and what the central bank may do about it if they veer off course.】

item.title: 在不确定性的迷雾中，美联储政策风暴可能即将来临
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（美联储）官员一致认为，唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税令他们失去了对经济走向的判断，他们可能会面临一场激烈的内部辩论，讨论正确的货币政策应对措施，包括平衡通胀和就业目标之间的任何冲突。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve officials, in agreement that President Donald Trump's tariffs have unmoored their sense of the economy's direction, may face an intense internal debate about the right monetary policy response, including balancing any conflicts between their inflation and employment goals.】

item.title: ASML 首席财务官称 2025 年迄今为止中国需求强于预期
item.description: 首席财务官罗杰-达森（Roger Dassen）周三告诉记者，2025年中国对ASML芯片制造工具的需求仍比预期强劲。【原文：Chinese demand for ASML's chip-making tools has remained stronger than expected in 2025, Chief Financial Officer Roger Dassen told journalists on Wednesday.】

item.title: 关税和经济衰退担忧给美国媒体盈利蒙上阴影
item.description: 华尔街分析师对第一季度好莱坞大部分地区的经济形势持悲观态度，他们警告说，唐纳德-特朗普总统反复无常的关税计划造成的经济不确定性削弱了消费者信心，加剧了人们对经济衰退的担忧。【原文：Wall Street analysts offered a gloomy view of the first quarter for much of Hollywood, warning that economic uncertainty caused by President Donald Trump's erratic tariff plans has undermined consumer confidence and heightened fears of a recession.】

item.title: 制药公司有望在短期内消化任何关税冲击
item.description: 美国对药品征收关税最终可能意味着品牌药品的价格上涨，但在短期内，这些成本很可能由制药商而不是患者来承担，因为患者的费用通常是由医疗保险来确定的。【原文：U.S. tariffs on pharmaceuticals could eventually mean higher prices for brand-name medicines, but in the near term the costs would likely be absorbed by drugmakers rather than patients whose payments are often set by health insurance.】

item.title: 美股期货下跌，英伟达因对华芯片出口新限制而暴跌
item.description: 周三，华尔街股指期货下跌，芯片宠儿英伟达（Nvidia）股价暴跌，原因是该公司表示，美国新的对华芯片出口限制措施将带来巨额费用，这加剧了市场对贸易战升级后果的担忧。【原文：Wall Street index futures dropped on Wednesday and chip darling Nvidia slumped after the company flagged steep charges from new U.S. curbs on chip exports to China, fuelling worries about the fallout of an escalating trade war.】

item.title: 谷歌因滥用在线搜索领域的主导地位而面临 50 亿英镑的英国诉讼
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司在英国遭到起诉，指控该公司滥用其在网络搜索行业的市场支配地位，可能造成价值约 50 亿英镑（66.4 亿美元）的损失。【原文：Alphabet's Google is being sued in Britain for potential damages worth about 5 billion pounds ($6.64 billion) alleging the company abused its dominant market position in the online search industry.】

item.title: 消息人士称，日本央行将下调经济增长预期，因美国加征关税带来冲击
item.description: 三位熟悉日本央行计划的消息人士称，日本央行将在4月30日至5月1日的政策会议上下调经济增长预期，因为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税措施加剧了依赖出口的脆弱复苏所面临的风险。【原文：The Bank of Japan is set to cut its economic growth forecasts at its April 30-May 1 policy meeting as U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs heighten risks to a fragile, export-reliant recovery, said three sources familiar with its plans.】

item.title: 上汽与华为合作开发的全新电动汽车品牌将于今年秋季推出首款车型
item.description: 华为消费者业务董事长余承东（Richard Yu）周三表示，中国汽车制造商上汽集团与科技集团华为（HWT.UL）共同开发的新电动汽车品牌已命名为 "尚捷"，首款车型将于秋季推出。【原文：Chinese automaker SAIC's new electric vehicle brand co-developed with technology conglomerate Huawei (HWT.UL) has been named Shangjie, with the first model to be launched in the autumn, Huawei's consumer business chairman Richard Yu said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 法拉利首席执行官表示，法拉利将继续投资汽油、混合动力和电动汽车动力系统
item.description: 豪华跑车制造商法拉利首席执行官本德托-维格纳（Bendetto Vigna）周三在公司年度股东大会上表示，法拉利将继续开发汽油、混合动力和全电动汽车。【原文：Luxury sportscar maker Ferrari will continue to develop petrol, hybrid and full-electric vehicles, its Chief Executive Bendetto Vigna said on Wednesday during the company's annual shareholders' meeting.】

item.title: 小米公司高管称不会携新款 YU7 参加中国最大车展
item.description: 小米公司不打算在下周举行的中国最大车展上展示其即将推出的 YU7 电动 SUV，这让渴望一睹特斯拉 Model Y 潜在挑战者风采的参观者们大失所望。【原文：Xiaomi does not plan to showcase its upcoming YU7 electric SUV at China's largest auto show next week, deflating widespread anticipation among visitors keen to catch a glimpse of the would-be challenger to Tesla's Model Y.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，英伟达向部分中国客户隐瞒了美国新的芯片管制措施
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，一周前，英伟达（Nvidia）被告知美国新的出口规定，要求其必须获得许可证才能销售其面向中国市场的人工智能芯片，但英伟达至少没有提前向一些主要客户发出警告。【原文：Nvidia did not warn at least some major customers in advance about new U.S. export rules it was told about a week ago requiring it to obtain licenses to sell its China-focused artificial intelligence chip, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 喜力啤酒第一季度销售额略超预期
item.description: 喜力周三公布的第一季度有机净收入增长了 0.9%，略高于分析师预期的略微下降，即使关税的不确定性仍然存在。【原文：Heineken on Wednesday reported a 0.9% increase in first-quarter organic net revenues, just exceeding analysts' expectations for a slight decline even as tariff uncertainty bites.】
